alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kit Carson and Sherman Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 316 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cold front 12 miles north of Ruleton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Kit Carson and Sherman Counties. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 25. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 448 and 450. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
